capabilities.details: Full essay generation with cited sources. The citation format makes output appear academically credible, increasing likelihood of student misuse.
Perplexity's core product is research synthesis. It can generate full literature reviews, argument outlines, and thesis-level content with real source citations.
Step-by-step mathematical problem solving with Pro models (GPT-4, Claude 3.5, Sonar Pro). Can solve homework problems across all grade levels.
Code generation available through underlying models. Can write full programming assignments.
Comet browser can autonomously complete online assignments: fill forms, navigate LMS platforms, answer multiple-choice quizzes, and submit work — all automatically.
Full book and article summarization. Can generate chapter summaries that substitute for reading the source material.
No detection of homework completion requests. Perplexity actively markets itself to students for academic use.
No academic integrity warnings when generating homework answers or essays.
No AI-output watermarking or detection signatures.
No guided learning or Socratic questioning mode. Unlike Khanmigo, Perplexity always provides direct answers rather than pedagogical guidance.
Perplexity's cited-source format makes AI-generated content appear more academically legitimate, potentially making detection harder for teachers who associate citations with genuine research.

detectionMethods.details: Perplexity's citation format and source-grounded writing style may reduce AI detection rates compared to other chatbots. Detection tools struggle with factual, citation-rich text.
Perplexity's professional citation format may fool teachers more easily than generic AI text. Sudden quality improvements and unfamiliar source materials are red flags.
Comet's agentic completion leaves minimal trace — it can appear as normal student browser activity. Comet masks machine actions as human clicks (per Amazon lawsuit).
